title: Oriental Stripe
text:
Most fashion fabrics are developed to be used as vertical patterns but many of the new nylon knit, Ja-eL designs were intended to be used in either direction or primarily as horizontal visuals.  <I>Oriental Stripe<I> is one of several patterns that highlighted border areas on skirts, dresses and pantsuits.  As a fashion statement <I>Sundown<I> was used almost exclusively as a vertical graphic, but toward the end of the decade when it metamorphosed into an upholstery fabric it was consistently featured in a horizontal orientation.  (See case in the center of this gallery)

The Larsen archive contains three colorways of <I>Oriental Stripe<I> and five colorways of <I>Sundown<I>.
description: Jersey striped print Jersey border hand print.  Printed horizontally.  Vertical stripes with circular motifs at lower edge. (blue/green)
